intro: Dupatya exigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along forest edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but can become invasive in certain environments.
